discovery.text: US codebreakers cracked Japanese communications and knew the attack plan in advance. America set the trap.

twist.text: Japanese carriers were rearming planes on deck when American dive bombers struck. Three carriers sank in minutes.

climax.text: Japan lost four carriersâ€”its offensive power in the Pacific was broken. America went on the offensive.

punchline.text: Codebreaking and four minutes changed a world war.

quiz.question: What gave America a decisive advantage at the Battle of Midway?
options: Superior numbers of aircraft and ships
Codebreakers had cracked Japan's plans in advance
Japan's fleet was damaged by a storm before the battle
